data.title: Obituaries
data.text:
Helen RABATIN (1923-1996)

Helen Rabatin, 73, of Smock, Pa., died Wednesday, July 10, 1996, in her home. She was born May 4, 1923, in Smock, Pa., the daughter of the late Michael and Mary Semonick Beercheck (Bircak). In addition to her parents she was preceded in death by five brothers, Michael, John, Joseph, Steve and Peter: and three sisters, Mary, Susan and Elizabeth. Surviving are her husband, Stephen A, Rabatin Jr.; four children, Joyce Medvitz and husband, Richard of Uniontown, Gregory and wife, Kimberly of Flatwoods, Gerald, at home and Lorraine of Bear Rocks; three grandchildren, Richard, Ryan and Melanie Medvitz; a sister, Ann Botek of Bedford Heights, Ohio; a sister-in-law, Margaret Beercheck of Uniontown, and many nieces and nephews. She was a member of the Hedwig Roman Catholic Church of Smock, the Ladies Auxiliary of the Smock Volunteer Fire Department and a former 4H Leader in Smock. Friends are being received in the HAKY FUNERAL HOME, 139 West Fayette St., Uniontown, this evening from 7 to 9 p.m., Friday from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m., and Saturday, July 13, 1996 until 9 a.m., in St Hedwig R.C. Church, Smock, with the Rev. Fr. John Sedlak as celebrant. Interment will follow in St. Hedwig Cemetery, Smock. A Vigil Service (remainder of article is missing.)

Local newspaper, Fayette County, PA, Thursday, July 11, 1996

Contributed by Marilyn Tolentino < SFFoster at aol.com>

Steve A. RABATIN, Sr. (1898-1976)

RABATIN, STEVE A. (SR.)— Age 78 years of Star Junction, Pa., died Monday, November 1, 1976 in the Uniontown Hospital at 10:30 a.m. He was born in Czechoslovakia on August 17, 1898. He was preceded in death by his wife, Catherine in 1975. Surviving are two sons, Steve Rabatin Jr. of Smock, Pa. and Edward Rabatin of Star Junction; two brothers, Andrew Rabatin and Joseph Rabatin both of Cleveland, Ohio; three sisters, Mrs. Katherine Hornyak and Mrs. Earl Tiedman both of Cleveland, Ohio and Mrs. Anna Evans of Pricedale, Pa.; seven grandchildren and four great-grandchildren. Friends are being received in the John W. Kallok Funeral Home, Cemetery Rd., Perryopolis, Pa. until Thursday where short prayers will be held at 10 a.m. followed by Mass of Christian Burial in St. Johns R.C. Church of Perryopolis at 10:30 a.m. with Rev. Fr. Frank Lesinowski and Rev. Fr. Larry Kiniry as celebrants. Interment in the Church Cemetery. Wake service will be held tonight at 8 p.m.

The Morning Herald, Uniontown, PA, Wednesday, November 3, 1976, page 41, column 8

Contributed by Marilyn Tolentino < SFFoster at aol.com>

Clyde E. RABBITT ( -1997)

Clyde E. Rabbitt

Clyde. E. Rabbitt, died on Sunday, Jan. 5, 1997, at his residence. Clyde was the husband of Veronica E., for 51 years and they were residents of Garfield Heights since 1949, father of Genie Kutolowski (James) and Chip Rabbitt (Karen), grandfather of Brian Kutolowski (Jody), and Bill and Sara Rabbitt, and brother of Walter V. Rabbitt and Dolores Mele. He was a truck driver for Refiners Transport for 15 years, retiring in 1983. Friends will be received in the Rybicki & Son Funeral Home, 4640 Turney Rd., Garfield Heights, Ohio, today from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m., Friday until 9:00 p.m., followed by a service at 9:30 a.m., in St Therese Church.

Local newspaper, Fayette County, PA, Thursday, January 9, 1997

Contributed by Marilyn Tolentino < SFFoster at aol.com>

Andrew RABEL died in 1935. His obit was contributed to the Fayette County USGenWeb Project.(2)

Andrew Rabel, aged 70 years, died suddenly following a stroke of apoplexy in his home at Griffin No. 2, near Masontown, where he had resided for 30 years, at 3 o'clock Sunday morning, April 28, 1935. He is survived by his widow, Anna Rabel, and the following children: Steve and Andy, Isabella; Mrs. Nick Molnar, Leckrone; Katherine, Joseph, and George, at home and Sue Rabel, New York City. Fifteen grandchildren and one great grandchild also survive.

Meeting at the residence the funeral cortege will proceed to the New Salem G. C. church where services will be conducted at 2 o'clock Wednesday afternoon in charge of the pastor, Rev. Fr. Czap. Burial will be in the church cemetery.

(newspaper dated April 29, 1935)

Mrs. Max RACKOFF died in 1938. Her obit was contributed to the Fayette County USGenWeb Project.(2)

Mrs. Max Rackoff, aged 49, a niece of G. M. and Isaac Silverman, of Uniontown, and a former prominent resident of Connellsville and Fayette county, died at 4 o'clock Monday afternoon, January 10, 1938, at her home in New Kensington, after a short illness of heart disease.

Prominent in club circles and social and civic activities in Uniontown and Connellsville, Mrs. Rackoff's death will be mourned by a wide circle of friends. She was the wife of Max Rackoff, who survives in addition to three children, Herbert, Raymond and Frances Rackoff, at home.

Funeral services will be held Wednesday in Pittsburgh. Joseph RACOSKY died in 1937. His obit was contributed to the Fayette County USGenWeb Project.(81)

JOSEPH RACOSKY

Joseph Racosky, of Fairbanks, died at 8:30 o'clock Wednesday night, April 21, 1937, in the family residence. Death was attributed to pneumonia with which he had been suffering only two days. He was at his regular work Monday of this week at Filbert.

[no attribution] Mrs. Mary RACOSKY died in 1937. Her obit was contributed to the Fayette County USGenWeb Project.(2)

Mrs. Mary Racosky, aged 54, died Saturday afternoon, September 25, 1937, at the family home in Fairbanks. Surviving are a son, Rudolph, and two daughters, Mrs. Clara Barbush, at home, and Mrs. Mary Barrick, of Filbert.

Funeral services will be held in the home at 8:30 Tuesday morning, with additional rites in St. Thomas church, at Footedale with Rev. Fr. Leo Buza as celebrant. Burial will be in the church cemetery.

(Herald - Sep 27, 1937) Rudolph RACOSKY died in 1937. His obit was contributed to the Fayette County USGenWeb Project.(2)

Rudolph Racosky, aged 21, of Fairbanks, died suddenly on Sunday, December 26, 1937, at the family home on the anniversary of the death of his mother, three months ago. He had been ill for two days and his death was attributed to a complication of diseases.

Surviving are two sisters, Mrs. Clara Barbush and Mrs. George Barrick, both of Filbert.

The body was removed to the Yoney Funeral Home in Masontown. Funeral plans are incomplete.

John M. RACUTT ( -1966)

RACUTT, JOHN M.— Age 45 years; died at the Huron RD Hospital, Cleveland, Ohio, April 6, 1966. He was the husband of Mary Jacob, (formerly of Uniontown), and is survived by the following children, John Jr., Steven, Connie Herda and Rose Mary Studnicka, Virginia, brothers and sisters, Adam, Uniontown, Walter, Andrew, Chicago, Pete, Minnesota, Nellie Zolner, New Jersey, Blanche Yost, Detroit, Helen Morofka, Cleveland, Francis Neff, Glenview, Ill., Marge Fantozzi, Chicago, IL. Friends are being received at the Jack Monreal Funeral Home, Wickcliffe, Ohio. Services will be held at the St. Mary Magdalene Church at 10 a.m. Saturday, April 9.

The Evening Standard, Uniontown, PA, Friday, April 8, 1966, page 20, column 8

Contributed by Marilyn Tolentino < SFFoster at aol.com>

Stanley F. RACZKOWSKI (1914-1994)

Stanley F. Raczkowski

Stanley F. Raczkowski, 80 of Suterville and a native of Blythedale died Thursday in his home. He is survived by his wife, Mary Ganio Raczkowski; one son, Stanley M. Raczkowski, and one daughter, Elaine Raczkowski Saccani, both of Sutersville; four grandchildren; five great-grandchildren; one brother, Adam Raczkowski of Monessen; and three sisters, Anna Duda of Norvelt, Mary Kufka of Bridgeville, and Sophie Chelen of Monessen. Visitation will be held today from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. and Monday until 10 a.m. at the J. William McCauley Jr. Funeral Home Inc., 901 Vine St., West Newton.

Social Security Death Index:

Born—– April 24, 1914

Died—– August 18, 1994

Local newspaper, Fayette County, PA, August, 1994

Contributed by Marilyn Tolentino < SFFoster at aol.com>

Michael RADATIN died in 1931. His obit was contributed to the Fayette County USGenWeb Project.(2)

Michael Radatin, aged 52, died Thursday, September 24, 1931, at 5 a.m., in the Uniontown Hospital, from the effects of injuries received early last week when struck by an automobile while walking along the Gates road. Surviving are two daughters, Anna at home and Mrs. Lena Sholtis, of Gates; one son, Michael, at home, and a brother Steven. Funeral services will be held Sunday at 1:30 from the late home with burial in St. John's cemetery, Connellsville.

(Genius - Sept. 25, 1931)

Joseph RADCLIFFE ( -1865)

SUDDEN DEATH— On Thursday last Mr. Joseph Radcliffe, an old and respected citizen of Upper Middletown, in this County, fell dead while engaged at work in one of his fields. We learn that Mr. Radcliffe was engaged, with one of his sons, in hauling in fodder, and while in the act of loading fell dead. Nothing unusual had been noticed about him, and from all appearance he was in good health during the day.

Genius of Liberty, Uniontown, PA, February 9, 1865, Vol. V, No. 1, page 2, column 3

Contributed by Roy Lockart

D. L. RADNEY died in 1935. His obit was contributed to the Fayette County USGenWeb Project.(2)

D. L. Radney, aged 86, of Allison, died at 12:20 a.m. Wednesday of complications. He is survived by his widow, Ola, two sons, Charles, of Calvert, Pa., and Arthur, of Cleveland, O., and a daughter Cora, of Williamsport.

For more than 50 years Mr. Radney was a member of the Odd Fellows lodge at Irondale, O.

Funeral details have not been completed.

(Genius - 1/31/1935)

Mary Pearl RADOVICH died in 1935. Her obit was contributed to the Fayette County USGenWeb Project.(2)

Funeral services for Mary Pearl Radovich, of Masontown, will be conducted at 2 o'clock Friday afternoon in the Greek Catholic church, Masontown, in charge of Rev. Fr. Soroka. Burial in the church cemetery.

Miss Radovich was fatally injured in an automobile accident early last Sunday morning, January 13, 1935, near Amityville, I. I., N. Y.

She was the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Eli Radovich who survives together with the following brothers and sisters: Mrs. Raddy Andesh, Carmichaels; Mrs. Alex Zorich, Poland Works; Anna, Delores, Steve, Mildred, Elizabeth, Dorothy, Edward and George Radovich, all at home.

(Standard - January 18, 1935)

Stella Dolores RADOVICH (1919-2006)

Stella Dolores Radovich, 86, of Footedale, Pa., passed away, Thursday, August 17, 2006, in Cherry Tree Nursing Center, Uniontown, Pa. She was born, October 24, 1919, in Footedale, Pa., a daughter of the late Michael and Mary Stelmock. Stella was a member of Saint Thomas Roman Catholic Church, Footedale. She was preceded in death by her husband, John Andrew Radovich in 1970, sisters, Ann Roll, Nellie Miller, Maggie Sowinski, and Helen Papernik, and a brother, Joe Stelmock. Stella was the last surviving member of her immediate family. Surviving are daughters: Barbara Zimcosky and husband, Thomas of Madison, Ohio, Pat Molek and husband, Victor of Hopwood, Pa., and Stephanie Dowling and husband, John of West Mifflin, Pa.; grandchildren: Chris Matuscak, Lisa Zimcosky, Toni Bildstein, David Zimcosky, Laura Zimcosky Tran, Victor Molek Jr., Dana Molek, and Ronald Molek; and ten great-grandchildren. Friends will be received in the ROBERT T. KISH FUNERAL HOME INC., 20 North Mill Street, New Salem, Pa., on Saturday, from 5 to 9 p.m., Sunday, from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m., and Monday, August 21, 2006, until 9:30 a.m., when a Prayer Service will be held. A Funeral Mass follows at 10 a.m., in Saint Thomas Church, Footedale, Pa., with Rev. Father James Popochock, as Celebrant. Interment will be held in Saint Thomas Cemetery. A Parish Wake Service will be held on Sunday at 7:30 p.m.

©The Herald Standard 2006, Uniontown, PA, Friday, August 18, 2006

Contributed by Marilyn Tolentino < SFFoster at aol.com>

Mrs. Lavera RADTKA obit was contributed to the Fayette County USGenWeb Project. (2)

Mrs. Lavera Radtka aged 69, of Allison, died at 4:35 Thursday morning in the Brownsville hospital after a lingering illness. Mrs. Radtka has made her home with a son-in-law and a daughter, Mr. and Mrs. Ray Norman, of Allison. In addition to Mrs. Norman, she leaves a son, Ernest, of Lewisburg, Pa., four sisters, Mrs. Lilly Pyle, Newburg, W.Va., Mrs. Mollie Eslick, New York City; Mrs. Birdie Satterfield, W.Va.; and Mrs. Della Fetty, Clarksburg, W.Va.; a brother, Richard, of Grafton, W.Va., and four grandchildren.

The body will be removed this evening to the home of Mrs. Harriet Walls, House 594, in Allison 2, where funeral services will be conducted at 2:30 Sunday afternoon. Burial will be in Acklin cemetery.

Minnie McElroy RADTKE (1893-1922)

MRS. THOMAS D. RADTKE

Mrs. Thomas D. Radtke, aged 29 years, of Scottdale, died in the Mt. Pleasant Hospital, Tuesday morning, March 21, 1922, at 4:45 oclock following an operation in that institution last Thursday morning. Funeral services will be held at the home of her parents, Mr. and Mrs. William R. McElroy, of Gallatin avenue, Friday afternoon at 2 oclock, Rev. G. W. Watson officiating. Interment will be in Oak Grove cemetery. Mrs. Radtke was born September 22, 1893 in this city, and lived practically all her life here. She graduated from the North Union township high school with the class of 1911, and became cashier at the Union Supply company store at Smock. She was later employed by the Fayello Supply company store at Oliver No. 1. On July 3, 1913, the deceased, who was formerly Miss Minnie McElroy, was married to Thomas D. Radtke, by Dr. Cloyd Goodnight. At the time of her death, she was a member of the Central Christian church of this city and of the Loyal Daughters class of that Sunday school. She was also a member of Uniontown Review, Ladies of the Maccabees. She is survived by her husband, her parents, and the following brothers and sisters, Mrs. Clark M. Lessig, William R. McElroy, Jr., and John McElroy, all of Uniontown.

The Morning Herald, Uniontown, PA, Thursday, March 23, 1922, page 8, column 2

FUNERAL OF MRS. RADTKE

Funeral services for the late Mrs. Thomas D. Radtke, of Scottdale, will be held Friday afternoon, March 24th, 1922, from the home of the parents, Mr. and Mrs. William R. McElroy, of Gallatin avenue, Uniontown, at 2 oclock. The Rev. G. W. Watson will officiate and will be assisted by the Rev. Paul White, of Scottdale. Interment will take place in Oak Grove cemetery.

The Morning Herald, Uniontown, PA, Friday, March 24, 1922, page 7, column 3

Contributed by Marilyn Tolentino < SFFoster at aol.com>

Mrs. Mary Ann RADVANSKY died in 1937. Her obit was contributed to the Fayette County USGenWeb Project.(2)

Mrs. Mary Ann Krofcheck Radvansky, 30, died at 6:20 o'clock Tuesday evening, April 27, 1937, in Uniontown hospital, following an extended illness. She was the wife of Adam J. Radvansky and resided at 65 North Morgantown street, Fair-????

(balance of obit is missing)

(Standard - April 28, 1937)

Louise Verset RAE ( -1971)

RAE, LOUISE VERSET— The family will receive friends in the Richard R. Herod Funeral Home, Point Marion, today from 2 to 4 and 7 to 10 p.m. and until 2 p.m. Tuesday, the hour of service with Rev. Joseph Gluck and Dr. Earl P. Confer officiating. Interment will be in Evergreen Memorial Park, Pt. Marion.

The Evening Standard, Uniontown, PA, Monday, February 15, 1971

Contributed by Marilyn Tolentino < SFFoster at aol.com>

Haley Marie RAFAIL (2005-2005)

Haley Marie Rafail, infant daughter of Waddia Rafail and Carol (Lowery) Rafail of Smithfield, Pa., born in Morgantown, W.Va., on Aug. 24, 2005, died Wednesday, Aug. 24, 2005, at 4:33 p.m., in the West Virginia University Hospital, Morgantown, W.Va., as the result of an automobile accident. In addition to her parents, she is survived by her grandfather, William Lowery of Smithfield, Pa.; grandmother, Sandra Garski Lowery of Smithfield, Pa.; and grandmother, Betty Rafail of West Leisenring, Pa. Haley was predeceased by her grandfather, Waddia Rafail Sr.; and great- grandparents, Charles "Jagger" Lowery and Kaushon Lowery. Friends are invited to call today at the JOHN S. MAYKUTH JR. FUNERAL HOME, Masontown, Pa., from 1:30 to 3:30 p.m., the time of the service, in the funeral home chapel, with the Rev. Randy Byers officiating. Interment will be in IOOF Cemetery, Smithfield, Pa.

©The Herald Standard 2005, Uniontown, PA, Friday, August 26, 2005

Contributed by Marilyn Tolentino < SFFoster at aol.com>

Hassoun RAFAIL ( -1962)

MRS. HASSOUN RAFAIL

Mrs. Hassoun Rafail, 74, of Uniontown, died Sunday at her home after an extended illness. She was a member of St. George Meronite R. C. Church and the Ladys Guild of St. George R. C. Church. Surviving are eight children, including Ferris, Mrs. Paul (Mae) Mitchell, Elias, George, Shomoonie, and Betty of Uniontown; 27 grandchildren and 17 great-grandchildren. Requiem high mass will be celebrated at 10 a.m. Wednesday in St. George R. C. Maronite Church. Interment will be in Park Place Cemetery.

Note from contributor:

Came to this country in 1884

The Daily Courier, Connellsville, PA, Tuesday, May 22, 1962, page 4, column 4

Contributed by Marilyn Tolentino < SFFoster at aol.com>

Joan RAFAIL (1938-1940)

JOAN RAFAIL

Joan Rafail, aged two, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Waddia Rafail, 103 Coolspring Street, died at 5:15 Tuesday morning, November 26, 1940, from illness or pneumonia. She was born September 19, 1938. In addition to her parents, she leaves the following brothers and sisters, Thomas, Waddia, Jr., Beatrice and Rita, at home, and her maternal grandparents, Mr. and Mrs. John M. Faris. Angel mass will be celebrated at 9 o'clock Friday morning in St. George's R. C. church, Lincoln street. Msgr. Hayek will be celebrant and burial will follow in Park Place cemetery, under the direction of Stephen Haky.

The Morning Herald, Uniontown, PA, Wednesday, November 27, 1940, page 3, column 4

Contributed by Marilyn Tolentino < SFFoster at aol.com>

Rose RAFAIL ( -1966)

Car Kills Woman On Cville St.

Mrs. Rose Rafail

Victim of Mishap

A Uniontown woman was killed last night when struck by a car on Connellsville Street shortly before midnight. Dead on arrival at Uniontown Hospital was Mrs. Rose W. Rafail, 61, of 103 Coolspring St. Mrs. Rafail suffered internal injuries when she was crossing Connellsville Street near the Thomas St. intersection and was struck by a vehicle operated by Dennis R. Helmick, 26, of Brownfield. Witnesses to the accident told city police Helmick swerved his car to avoid hitting Mrs. Rafail but could not avoid the accident. Uniontown fireman's ambulance took the victim to the hospital where she was pronounced dead at approximately 11:50 p.m. Mrs. Rafail was a member of St. George Maronite R. C. Church, Ladies Guild of the Church, St. Joseph's Confraternity of Christian Mothers and the Ladies Auxiliary of the Lebanese Club. She was preceded in death by her husband, Waddia, Sr., in 1952 and a son, Thomas, in 1963. Survivors include the following children: Mrs. Duane (Beatrice) Mills of Uniontown, Mrs. Michael (Rita) Koury of Connellsville, and Joseph F. and Waddia, Jr., both at home; the following brothers and sisters: John Faris, Jr. and Mrs. Anna Joseph, both of Uniontown; Si Faris of Rollsburg, W. Va.; Carmen Kay Faris of San Antonio, Tex.; Samuel Fais of Baltimore, Md., and Mrs. Walter (Margaret) Magda, of Midland, and 12 grandchildren. Friends will be received at Haky Funeral Home from 7 to 10 p.m. on Friday, and 2 to 5 and 7 to 10 p.m. on Saturday and Sunday. A prayer service will be held at the funeral home at 9:3O a.m. on Monday followed by Solemn Requiem High Mass at 10 in St. George Church. Burial will be in Park Place Cemetery.

Notes from contributor: Daughter of John Niggen Faris and Shomena Salem Faris

The Evening Standard, Uniontown, PA, Thursday, May 19, 1966, page 1, column 7

Contributed by Marilyn Tolentino < SFFoster at aol.com>

Salem RAFAIL (1932-1933)

SALEM RAFAIL

Salem Rafail, son of Mr. and Mrs. Waddie Rafail, died in the family residence, 98 Coolspring Street, Uniontown, Pa., at 10 o'clock Monday night, September 18, 1933, following an illness of pneumonia. He was aged one year and four days. Only last Thursday, September 14, he was christened with seven of his cousins, in the home of his uncle, Gaston Rafail. Surviving, besides his parents, are one brother, Thomas and two sisters, Beatrice and Reta Rafail, all at home. Funeral arrangements will be announced later.

The Morning Herald, Uniontown, PA, Tuesday, September 19, 1933, page 4, column 2

SALIM RAFAIL FUNERAL

Funeral services for Salim Rafail, 10-month-old son of Mr. and Mrs. Wadda Rafail, who died of pneumonia Monday night at the home of his parents in 96 Coolspring street, were held Wednesday morning at 9 o'clock at the home with Father Hayek officiating. Burial was in Park Place Cemetery.

The Morning Herald, Uniontown, PA, Thursday, September 21, 1933, page 4, column 4

Contributed by Marilyn Tolentino < SFFoster at aol.com>

Shmoonie 'Mimi' RAFAIL (1929-2009)

Shmoonie (Mimi) Rafail, of Uniontown, Fayette County, Pa., passed away on March 3, 2009 at the Uniontown Hospital, with her family by her bedside. Mimi was born in Uniontown, Pa., on March 1, 1929, the daughter of Gestin and Hassoun (Salim) Rafail. Mimi was a member of St. George Maronite Catholic Church, in Uniontown, the Altar Rosary Society, and the Ladies Guild of St. George. "Aunt" Mimi looked forward to spending time with her nieces and nephews and to her daily trips to ABC School House. She loved to travel and to play penny slots and bingo. In addition to her parents, she was preceded by 3 brothers, Ferris, Rafail (Ray), and George, and 2 sisters Mae Mitchell and Iona George. Mimi is survived by her loving and devoted sister, Betty M. Rafail, with whom she made her home; 2 brothers: Francis Rafail, of Waynesburg, Greene County, Pa., and Elias Rafail, of Uniontown, and numerous adoring nieces and nephews. Friends will be received in the THOMAS M. DOLFI FUNERAL HOME, 136 N. Gallatin Ave. on Friday, March 6, 2009, from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m., and on Saturday until 9:30 a.m., at which time Prayers of Transfer will be recited, followed by a Mass of Christian Burial at St. George Maronite Catholic Church, with Fr. Phillip Kanfush and Sub Deacon Thomas R. George, presiding. Interment will follow in Sylvan Heights Cemetery, in Uniontown. On Friday, the Altar Rosary Society will recite the rosary at 3:00 p.m. and the parish will do a Ghinnaz Service at 7:30 p.m.

©The Herald Standard 2009, Uniontown, PA, Friday, March 6, 2009

Contributed by Marilyn Tolentino < SFFoster at aol.com>

Waddia Anthony RAFAIL, Jr. (1940-2002)

WADDIA ANTHONY RAFAIL, JR.

Waddia Anthony Rafail Jr., 62 of Smithfield Pa, died Wednesday, February 6, 2002 in Ruby Memorial Hospital. He was born February 3, 1940, in Uniontown, a son of the late Waddia Anthony Rafail, Sr. and Rose Faris Rafail. In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by a sister, Beatrice Mills; and a brother Tom Rafail. Waddia was a member of Fairchance Church of Worship, was a graduate of St. John's High School, and attended St. Vincent College. He was the owner and operator of Waddia Rafail Beer Distributor in the area and was a good family man who loved his family. He is survived by his wife Betty Stark Rafail; six children, Rose Sanders and husband Robert, Jr. of Masontown, Waddia Anthony Rafail, III, and wife Carol, Jerome Rafail and wife Billie, Phillip M. Rafail, Lisa M. Rafail and Beth Ann Rafail, all of Smithfield; four grandchildren, Robert Sanders, III, Joshua Sanders, Julie Sanders and Jerome Edward Rafail; a sister Rita Koury, of Connellsville; a brother Joseph Rafail and wife Ann, of Pittsburgh; and several nieces and nephews. Friends will be received in the Haky Funeral Home, Inc., a Dignity Provider, 139 W. Fayette Street, Sunday from 2 -4 and 7-9 p.m. and Monday, Feb 11, until 11 a.m., the hour of service, with Pastor Mark Kephart officiating. Interment will follow in Park Place Cemetery.

Dominion Post, Morgantown, WV,

Saturday, February 9, 2002

Contributed by Marilyn Tolentino < SFFoster at aol.com>

Anna C. RAFFLE died in 1938. Her obit was contributed to the Fayette County USGenWeb Project.(2)

Mrs. Anna Chocola Raffle, aged 42, wife of William Raffle, well-known Uniontown city fireman, died suddenly at 1:30 this morning in the Uniontown hospital where she had been a patient since last Thursday. Death was attributed to a complication of diseases.

Mrs. Raffle was one of Uniontown's best known residents. Active in the affairs of the Great Bethel Baptist church, her death comes as a distinct shock to a wide circle of ????

(balance of obit is missing)

(Standard - August 24, 1938)

Margaret McClintock RAFITZ ( -1997)

Margaret (McClintock) Rafitz, 75, of Uniontown, Pa., died Wednesday, Jan. 8, 1997, in Uniontown Hospital. Friends will be received this evening from 7 to 9 p.m., and Friday from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Funeral arrangements are incomplete and will be announced on Friday by the Haky Funeral Home of Uniontown.

Local newspaper, Fayette County, PA, Wednesday, January 8, 1997

Contributed by Marilyn Tolentino < SFFoster at aol.com>

Emma RAFTER (1902-1994)

RAFTER, EMMA— Smock, Pa. died Monday, May 16, 1994 at her home. She was born March 16, 1902 in United, Pa., daughter of the late Charles and Mary Jaworski. She was also predeceased by her husband, Patrick J. Rafter, Sr. in 1978; two sons: James and John Rafter; and eight brothers and three sisters. She was a member of St. Hedwig R.C. Church, Smock and the Confraternity of Christian Mothers. Surviving are these children; Betty Bencze of Carmichaels, Pa., Mrs. Walter (Katie) Gilsdorf of Lexington, S.C., Mrs. Vincent (Emma) Florkewitz of Fairfield, N.J., Patrick J. Rafter, at home Edward Rafter of Smock, Agnes Rafter of Lyndhurst N.J., and Mrs. Bernadette Padula of Fair Lawn, N.J., Frances Rafter, at home, Robert Rafter and his wife, Donna of Uniontown, Richard Rafter and wife Maureen of Lyndhurst, N. J. and daughter-in-law, Elizabeth Rafter of Perryopolis; 15 grandchildren, eight great grandchildren; a brother, Sylvester Jaworski of Leisenring 1; one sister, Mrs. Bridget Stock of Crowley, Texas and a sister-in-law, Miss Mary Rafter of Uniontown. Friends are being received in the HAKY FUNERAL HOME, 139 W. Fayette St., Uniontown, today from 2 to 4 p.m. and 7 to 9 p.m., and Thursday until 9:15 a.m., when a prayer service will be held, followed by a Mass of Christian Burial in St. Hedwig R.C. Church, Smock, at 10 a.m. with Rev. Edward J. Kretz as celebrant. Interment will follow in St. Vincent DePaul Cemetery in Leisenring 1, Pa.

Local newspaper, Fayette County, PA, Wednesday, May 18, 1994

Contributed by Marilyn Tolentino < SFFoster at aol.com>

Michael RAFTER ( -1923)

Michael Rafter, about 80 years of age, died Monday morning, February 19, 1923, at his home at Ohiopyle. He had been a lifelong resident of the town and was at one time section foreman for the Baltimore and Ohio railroad. He was born in Ireland, coming to this country when a boy. At the time of his death he was borough assessor. He was a member of the borough council and also the M. E. church. He is survived by his wife, Rachel, one son, Richard Rafter, and three daughters, Mrs. John Stewart, Mrs. R. A. Marshall and Mrs. Connelly.

Funeral services will be held from the late home at Ohiopyle Wednesday afternoon at 2 oclock.

The Morning Herald, Uniontown, PA, Tuesday, February 20, 1923, page 13, columns 1&2

Contributed by Ruth Sprowls < ruthsprowls at windstream.net>

Richard H. RAFTER ( -1935)

RICHARD H. RAFTER DIES

VERY SUDDENLY FROM HEART ATTACK

Stricken with a heart attack, Richard H. Rafter, 65 years old, of Uniontown fell dead from a chair Monday afternoon at 5:05 oclock at the home of Johnson VanKirk, 85 years old, an invalid of Merrittstown. Mr. Rafter had been nursing Mr. VanKirk and was sitting in a chair beside him, when he was stricken. He was a brother-in-law of Fire Chief W. E. DeBolt of Connellsville. Mr. Rafter was born at Ohiopyle, a son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Michael Rafter, and is well known in this community, having been employed by W. J. Rainey, Inc., at Elm Grove for 30 years. He moved from Elm Grove to Uniontown and was employed by the Oliver Steel Company until the works closed. He was twice married, his first wife being Miss Missouri DeBolt. His second wife, Mrs. Florence Rafter, and three children to the first marriage survive, as follows: Mrs. Freda Gibson of Connellsville, Harry Rafter of Uniontown, R.D., and Mrs. Stella Martin of Morgantown, W. Va. Three sisters also survive. They are: Mrs. Nancy Connelly of Duquesne, Mrs. Nora Marshall of McKeesport and Mrs. Mary Stewart of Connellsville. There are six grandchildren. Mr. Rafter was a member of the Uniontown Council, Junior Order United American Mechanics. The funeral service will be held Thursday afternoon. After a short service at the home, 212 Whyel avenue, Uniontown, the body will be taken to the Methodist Church at Ohiopyle, where a full service will be conducted. Interment will be at Ohiopyle.

Richard Randolph

Succumbs in Home

Richard Randolph, one of Uniontown and Fayette county's most widely known residents and a lifelong resident, died at 4:15 o'clock Sunday morning, January 5, 1936, in his residence, 37 South Gallatin avenue. Death came following a three weeks illness. He was aged 82 years, six months and eight days. Mr. Randolph was a son of the late Nelson and Sarah Keys Randolph having been born June 28, 1852 in Redstone township where his grandfather settled in 1795. An active farmer of that township, Mr. Randolph, in 1903, became actively involved in real estate, transferring his place of residence to Uniontown. He was preceded in death, March 1, 1920, by his wife, Clara Barre Randolph, and two daughters, Mary, who died at the age of three years in 1897 and Martha H. Benson, wife of W. H. Benson, who died January 23, 1932. Surviving are the following children: Mrs. A. C. Lee, Masontown; Mrs. W. B. Jacobs, Uniontown; Mrs. J. C. Ache, McClellandtown; Mrs. W. C. Whetsel, Uppermiddletown; J. Nelson Randolph, Searights; Irvin K., McKeesport; George E., Brownsville; Clarence R., McKeesport; Levi S., Uniontown and Harold R. Randolph, of Wilkinsburg. Thirty one grandchildren and 27 great grandchildren also survive. Rev. Donald Kent Johnston, pastor of St. Peters Episcopal church, will conduct funeral services at 2 o'clock Tuesday afternoon in the W. B. Jacobs residence, 42 North Mt. Vernon avenue. Rev. E. Conn Plaes, D. D., pastor of the Third Presbyterian church, will assist.

George RANKER died in 1931. His obit was contributed to the Fayette County USGenWeb Project.(2)

George Ranker, aged 34 years, a widely known resident of Connellsville, died at 1:30 a.m., Tuesday, June 2, 1931, in the Uniontown Hospital. Death was due to complications arising from three major operations within the period of the past year. He was a salesman for the Mason Motor Company, of Connellsville.

Mr. Ranker was a son of Mrs. Clara E. and the late John J. Ranker and was born in Connellsville.

In addition to his mother, he is survived by his widow; two children, Clara Jean and Mary Anne, and the following brothers and sisters: Mrs. Bowman Roth, of Uniontown; Mrs. Harry G. Mason, Mrs. William Carroll, Miss Cornelia Ranker, John J., Frederick H., and Eugene Ranker, all of Connellsville.
